definition: Use of similar grammatical structures to express related ideas, creating rhythm and emphasis

positive_examples: 'I came, I saw, I conquered' - tricolon with parallel verb phrases.
'Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.'
Parallel: 'by the people, for the people, of the people.'
Faulty parallelism: 'I like swimming, biking, and to run' (mixing forms).
training_hints.disambiguation: Deliberately matching grammatical structures, not just having grammar
